Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:88: Moses prayed: "Our Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on Pharaoh and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of the present, and so, Our Lord, they mislead (men) from Thy Path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:89: God said: "Accepted is your prayer (O Moses and Aaron)! So stand ye straight, and follow not the path of those who know not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:90: We took the Children of Israel across the sea: Pharaoh and his hosts followed them in insolence and spite.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:91: (It was said to him): "Ah now!- But a little while before, wast thou in rebellion!- and thou didst mischief (and violence)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:92: "This day shall We save thee in the body, that thou mayest be a sign to those who come after thee! but verily, many among mankind are heedless of Our Signs!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:93: We settled the Children of Israel in a beautiful dwelling-place, and provided for them sustenance of the best: it was after knowledge had been granted to them, that they fell into schisms.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:94: If thou wert in doubt as to what We have revealed unto thee, then ask those who have been reading the Book from before thee: the Truth hath indeed come to thee from thy Lord: so be in no wise of those in doubt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:95: Nor be of those who reject the signs of God, or thou shalt be of those who perish.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:96: Those against whom the word of thy Lord hath been verified would not believe-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:97: Even if every Sign was brought unto them,- until they see (for themselves) the penalty grievous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:98: Why was there not a single township (among those We warned), which believed,- so its faith should have profited it,- except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the penalty of ignominy in the life of the present, and permitted them to enjoy (their life) for a while.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:99: If it had been thy Lord’s will, they would all have believed,- all who are on earth! wilt thou then compel mankind, against their will, to believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:100: No soul can believe, except by the will of God, and He will place doubt (or obscurity) on those who will not understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:101: Say: "Behold all that is in the heavens and on earth"; but neither Signs nor Warners profit those who believe not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:102: Do they then expect (any thing) but (what happened in) the days of the men who passed away before them? Say: "Wait ye then: for I, too, will wait with you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:103: In the end We deliver Our apostles and those who believe: Thus is it fitting on Our part that We should deliver those who believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:104: Say: "O ye men! If ye are in doubt as to my religion, (behold!) I worship not what ye worship, other than God! But I worship God - Who will take your souls (at death): I am commanded to be (in the ranks) of the Believers,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:105: "And further (thus): ’set thy face towards religion with true piety, and never in any wise be of the Unbelievers;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:106: "’Nor call on any, other than God;- Such will neither profit thee nor hurt thee: if thou dost, behold! thou shalt certainly be of those who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:107: If God do touch thee with hurt, there is none can remove it but He: if He do design some benefit for thee, there is none can keep back His favour: He causeth it to reach whomsoever of His servants He pleaseth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:108: Say: "O ye men! Now Truth hath reached you from your Lord! those who receive guidance, do so for the good of their own souls; those who stray, do so to their own loss: and I am not (set) over you to arrange your affairs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 10:109: Follow thou the inspiration sent unto thee, and be patient and constant, till God do decide: for He is the best to decide.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:2: Was it a wonder to the people that We revealed to a man from among them: ’Warn the people, and give thou good tidings to the believers that they have a sure footing with their Lord’? The unbelievers say, ’This is a manifest sorcerer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:3: Surely your Lord is God, who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then sat Himself upon the Throne, directing the affair.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:4: To Him shall you return, all together -- God’s promise, in truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:5: It is He who made the sun a radiance, and the moon a light, and determined it by stations, that you might know the number of the years and the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:6: In the alternation of night and day, and what God has created in the heavens and the earth -- surely there are signs for a godfearing people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:7: Surely those who look not to encounter Us and are well-pleased with the present life and are at rest in it, and those who are heedless of Our signs,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:8: those -- their refuge is the Fire, for that they have been earning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:9: Surely those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness, their Lord will guide them for their belief; beneath them rivers flowing in gardens of bliss;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:10: their cry therein, ’Glory to Thee, O God,’ their greeting, ’Peace,’ and their cry ends, ’Praise belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:11: If God should hasten unto men evil as they would hasten good, their term would be already decided for them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:12: When affliction visits a man, he calls Us on his side, or sitting, or standing; but when We have removed his affliction from him, he passes on, as if he never called Us to an affliction that visited him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:13: We destroyed the generations before you when they did evil, and their Messengers came to them with the clear signs, but they would not believe; so We recompense the people of the sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:14: Then We appointed you viceroys in the earth after them, that We might behold how you would do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:15: And when Our signs are recited to them, clear signs, those who look not to encounter Us say, ’Bring a Koran other than this, or alter it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:16: Say: ’Had God willed I would not have recited it to you, neither would He have taught you it; I abode among you a lifetime before it -- will you not understand?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:17: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to His signs? Surely the sinners do not prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:18: They serve, apart from God, what hurts them not neither profits them, and they say, ’These are our intercessors with God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:19: Mankind were only one nation, then they fell into variance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:20: They say, ’Why has a sign not been sent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ’The Unseen belongs only to God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:21: When We let the people taste mercy after hardship has visited them, lo, they have a device concerning Our signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:22: It is He who conveys you on the land and the sea; and when you are in the ship -- and the ships run with them with a fair breeze, and they rejoice in it, there comes upon them a strong wind, and waves come on them from every side, and they think they are encompassed; they call upon God, making their religion His sincerely: ’If Thou deliverest us from these, surely we shall be among the thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:23: Nevertheless when He has delivered them behold, they are insolent in the earth, wrongfully.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:24: The likeness of this present life is as water that We send down out of heaven, and the plants of the earth mingle with it whereof men and cattle eat, till, when the earth has taken on its glitter and has decked itself fair, and its inhabitants think they have power over it, Our command comes upon it by night or day, and We make it stubble, as though yesterday it flourished not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:25: And God summons to the Abode of Peace, and He guides whomsoever He will to to a straight path;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:26: the good-doers the reward most fair and a surplus; neither dust nor abasement shall overspread their faces.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:27: And for those who have earned evil deeds the recompense of an evil deed shall be the like of it; abasement shall overspread them, neither have they any defender from God, as if their faces were covered with strips of night shadowy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:28: And the day We shall muster them all, then We shall say to those who associate other gods with God: ’Get you to your place, you and your associates!’ Then We shall set a space between them, and their associates will say, ’Not us you were serving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:29: God is a sufficient witness between us and you; assuredly we were heedless of your service.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:30: There every soul shall prove its past deeds; and they shall be restored to God, their Protector, the True, and there shall go astray from them that they were forging.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:31: Say: ’Who provides you out of heaven and earth, or who possesses hearing and sight, and who brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and who directs the affair?’ They will surely say, ’God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:32: That then is God, your Lord, the True; what is there, after truth, but error? Then how are you turned about?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:33: Thus the word of thy Lord is realized against the ungodly that they believe not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:34: Say: ’Is there any of your associates who originates creation, then brings it back again?’ Say: ’God -- He originates creation, then brings it back again; so how are you perverted?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:35: Say: ’Is there any of your associates who guides to the truth?’ Say: ’God -- He guides to the truth; and which is worthier to be followed -- He who guides to the truth, or he who guides not unless he is guided? What then ails you, how you judge?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:36: And the most of them follow only surmise, and surmise avails naught against truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:37: This Koran could not have been forged apart from God; but it is a confirmation of what is before it, and a distinguishing of the Book, wherein is no doubt, from the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:38: Or do they say, ’Why, he has forged it’? Say: ’Then produce a sura like it, and call on whom you can, apart from God, if you speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:39: No; but they have cried lies to that whereof they comprehended not the knowledge, and whose interpretation has not yet come to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:40: And some of them believe in it, and some believe not in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:41: If they cry lies to thee, then do thou say: ’I have my work, and you have your work; you are quit of What I do, and I am quit of what you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:42: And some of them give ear to thee; what, wilt thou make the deaf to hear, though they understand not?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:43: And some of them look unto thee; what, wilt thou then guide the blind, though they do not see?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:44: Surely God wrongs not men anything, but themselves men wrong.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:45: And the day He shall muster them, as if they had not tarried but an hour of the day, mutually recognizing one another; lost will be those who cried lies to the encounter with God, and were not guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:46: Whether We show thee a part of that We promise them, or We call thee unto Us, to Us they shall return; then God is witness of the things they do
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:47: Every nation has its Messenger; then, when their Messenger comes, justly the issue is decided between them, and they are not wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:48: They say, ’When will this promise be, if you speak truly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:49: Say: ’I have no power to profit for myself, or hurt, but as God will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:50: Say: ’Have you considered? If His chastisement comes upon you by night or day, what part of it will the sinners seek to hasten?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:51: What, when it has come to pass, will you then believe in it? Now, when already you seek to hasten it!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:52: Then it will be said to the evildoers: ’Taste the chastisement of eternity! Are you recompensed for aught but that you have been earning?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:53: They ask thee to tell them, ’Is it true?’ Say: ’Yes, by my Lord! It is true; you cannot frustrate Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:54: If every soul that has done evil possessed all that is in the earth, he would offer it for his ransom; and they will be secretly remorseful when they see the chastisement, and justly the issue is decided between them, and they are not wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:55: Why, surely to God belongs everything that is in the heavens and earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:56: He gives life, and makes to die, and to Him you shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:57: O men, now there has come to you an admonition from your Lord, and a healing for what is in the breasts, and a guidance, and a mercy to the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:58: Say: ’In the bounty of God, and His mercy -- in that let them rejoice; it is better than that they amass.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:59: Say: ’Have you considered the provision God has sent down for you, and you have made some of it unlawful, and some lawful?’ Say: ’Has God given you leave, or do you forge against God?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:60: What will they think, who forge falsehood against God; on the Day of Resurrection? God is bountiful to men; but most of them are not thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:61: Thou art not upon any occupation, neither recitest thou any Koran of it, nor do you any work, without that We are witnesses over you when you press on it; and not so much as the weight of an ant in earth or heaven escapes from thy Lord, neither is aught smaller than that, or greater, but in a Manifest Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:62: Surely God’s friends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:63: Those who believe, and are godfearing --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:64: for them is good tidings in the present life and in the world to come.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:65: And do not let their saying grieve thee; the glory belongs altogether to God; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:66: Why, surely to God belongs everyone that is in the heavens and in the earth; they follow, who call upon associates, apart from God -- they follow nothing but surmise, merely conjecturing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:67: It is He who made for you the night to repose in it, and the day, to see; surely in that are signs for a people who have ears.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:68: They say, ’God has taken to Him a son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:69: Say: ’Those who forge against God falsehood shall not prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:70: Some enjoyment in this world; then unto Us they shall return; then We shall let them taste the terrible chastisement, for that they were unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:71: And recite to them the story of Noah when he said to his people, ’My people, if my standing here is grievous to you and my reminding you of the signs of God, in God have I put my trust; so resolve on your affair, with your associates, then let not your affair be a worry to you, but make decision unto me, and respite me not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:72: Then if you turn your backs, I have not asked you for any wage; my wage falls only on God, and I have been commanded to be of those that surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:73: But they cried him lies; so We delivered him, and those with him, in the Ark, and We appointed them as viceroys, and We drowned those who cried lies to Our signs; then behold how was the end of them that were warned!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:74: Then We sent forth, after him, Messengers to their people, and they brought them the clear signs; but they were not men to believe in that they had cried lies to before.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:75: Then We sent forth, after them, Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his Council with Our signs, but they waxed proud, and were a sinful people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:76: So, when the truth came to them from Us, they said, ’Surely this is a manifest sorcery.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:77: Moses said, ’What, do you say this to the truth, when it has come to you? Is this a sorcery? But sorcerers do not prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:78: They said, ’Art thou come to us to turn us from that we found our fathers practising, and that the domination in the land might belong to you two? We do not believe you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:79: Pharaoh said, ’Bring me every cunning sorcerer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:80: Then, when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, ’Cast you down what you will cast.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:81: Then, when they had cast, Moses said, ’What you have brought is sorcery; God will assuredly bring it to naught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:82: God verifies the truth by His words, though sinners be averse.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:83: So none believed in Moses, save a seed of his people, for fear of Pharaoh and their Council, that they would persecute them; and Pharaoh was high in the land, and he was one of the prodigals.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:84: Moses said, ’O my people, if you believe in God, in Him put your trust, if you have surrendered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:85: They said, ’In God we have put our trust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:86: and deliver us by Thy mercy from the people of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:87: And We revealed to Moses and his brother, ’Take you, for your people, in Egypt certain houses; and make your houses a direction for men to pray to; and perform the prayer; and do thou give good tidings to the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:88: Moses said, ’Our Lord, Thou hast given to Pharaoh and his Council adornment and possessions in this present life.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:89: He said, ’Your prayer is answered; so go you straight, and follow not the way of those that know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:90: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea; and Pharaoh and his hosts followed them insolently and impetuously till, when the drowning overtook him, he said, ’I believe that there is no god but He in whom the Children of Israel believe; I am of those that surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:91: ’Now? And before thou didst rebel, being of those that did corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:92: So today We shall deliver thee with thy body, that thou mayest be a sign to those after thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:93: And We settled the Children of Israel in a sure settlement, and We provided them with good things; so they differed not until the knowledge came to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:94: So, if thou art in doubt regarding what We have sent down to thee, ask those who recite the Book before thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:95: nor be of those who cry lies to God’s signs so as to be of the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:96: Those against whom thy Lord’s word is realized will not believe,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:97: though every sign come to them, till they see the painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:98: Why was there never a city that believed, and its belief profited it? -- Except the people of Jonah; when they believed, We removed from them the chastisement of degradation in this present life, and We gave unto them enjoyment for a time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:99: And if thy Lord had willed, whoever is in the earth would have believed, all of them, all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:100: It is not for any soul to believe save by the leave of God; and He lays abomination upon those who have no understanding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:101: Say: ’Behold what is in the heavens and in the earth!’ But neither signs nor warnings avail a people who do not believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:102: So do they watch and wait for aught but the like of the days of those who passed away before them? Say: ’Then watch and wait; I shall be with you watching and waiting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:103: Then We shall deliver Our Messengers and the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:104: Say: ’O men, if you are in doubt regarding my religion, I serve not those you serve apart from God, but I serve God, who will gather you to Him, and I am commanded to be of the believers, and:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:105: "Set thy face to the religion, a man of pure faith, and be thou not of the idolaters;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:106: and do not call, apart from God, on that which neither profits nor hurts thee, for if thou dost, then thou wilt surely be of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:107: And if God visits thee with affliction, none can remove it but He; and if He desires any good for thee, none can repel His bounty; He causes it to fall upon whomsoever He will of His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:108: Say: ’O men, the truth has come to you from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 10:109: And follow thou what is revealed to thee; and be thou patient until God shall judge; and He is the best of judges.

Muhammad Asad.verse 10:2: Do people deem it strange that We should have inspired a man from their own midst [with this Our message]: "Warn all mankind, and give unto those who have attained to faith the glad tiding that in their Sustainer’s sight they surpass all others in that they are completely sincere"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:3: they who deny the truth say, "Behold, he is clearly but a spellbinder!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:4: VERILY, your Sustainer is God, who has created the heavens and the earth in six aeons, and is established on the throne of His almightiness, governing all that exists.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:5: will you not, then, keep this in mind?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:6: Unto Him you all must return: this is, in truth, God’s promise – for, behold, He creates
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:7: in the first instance, and then brings him forth anew to the end that He may reward with equity all who attain to faith and do righteous deeds; whereas for those who are bent on denying the truth there is in store a draught of burning despair and grievous suffering because of their persistent refusal to acknowledge the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:8: He it is who has made the sun a [source of] radiant light and the moon a light ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:9: and has determined for it phases so that you might know how to compute the years and to measure .
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:10: None of this has God created without [an inner] truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:12: for, verily, in the alternating of night and day, and in all that God has created in the heavens and on earth there are messages indeed for people who are conscious of Him!
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:13: Verily, as for those who do not believe that they are destined to meet Us, but content themselves with the life of this world and do not look beyond it, and are heedless of Our messages
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:14: their goal is the fire in return for all [the evil] that they were wont to do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:16: verily, as for those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds – their Sustainer guides them aright by means of their faith.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:18: in that [state of happiness] they will call out, "Limitless art Thou in Thy glory, O God!" – and will be answered with the greeting, "Peace!" And their call will close with [the words] "All praise is due to God, the Sustainer of all the worlds!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:19: NOW IF GOD were to hasten for human beings the ill [which they deserve by their sinning] in the same manner as they
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:20: would hasten [the coming to them of what they consider to be] good, their end would indeed come forthwith! But We leave them alone [for a while] – all those who do not believe that they are destined to meet Us: [We leave them alone] in their overweening arrogance, blindly stumbling to and fro.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:21: For [thus it is:] when affliction befalls man, he cries out unto Us, whether he be lying on his side or sitting or standing; but as soon as We have freed him of his affliction, he goes on as though he had never invoked Us to save him from the affliction that befell him! Thus do their own doings seem goodly unto those who waste their own selves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:22: And, indeed, We destroyed before your time
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:24: did evil although the apostles sent unto them brought them all evidence of the truth; for they refused to believe .
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:25: Thus do We requite people who are lost in sin.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:26: And thereupon We made you their successors on earth, so that We might behold how you act.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:27: AND [thus it is:] whenever Our messages are conveyed unto them in all their clarity, those who do not believe that they are destined to meet Us [are wont to] say, "Bring us a discourse other than this, or alter this one.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:28: to rebel against my Sustainer, the suffering [which would befall me] on that awesome Day [of Judgment]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:30: I would not have conveyed this [divine writ] unto you, nor would He have brought it to your knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:31: And who could be more wicked than they who attribute their own lying inventions to God or give the lie to His messages? Verily, those who are lost in sin will never attain to a happy state
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:33: worship, side by side with God, things or beings that can neither harm nor benefit them, saying [to themselves], "These are our intercessors with God!" Say: "Do you [think that you could] inform God of anything in the heavens or on earth that He does not know? Limitless is He in His glory, and sublimely exalted above anything to which men may ascribe a share in His divinity!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:34: AND [know that] all mankind were once but one single community, and only later did they begin to hold divergent views.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:35: NOW THEY [who deny the truth] are wont to ask, "Why has no miraculous sign ever been bestowed upon him from on high by his Sustainer?" Say, then: "God’s alone is the knowledge of that which is beyond the reach of human perception.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:36: And [thus it is:] whenever We let
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:37: people taste [some of Our] grace after hardship has visited them – lo! they forthwith turn to devising false arguments against Our messages.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:38: messengers are recording all that you may devise!
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:39: He it is who enables you to travel on land and sea.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:40: Yet as soon as He has saved them from this ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:41: lo! they behave outrageously on earth, offending against all right! O men! All your outrageous deeds are bound to fall back upon your own selves! [You care only for] the enjoyment of life in this world: [but remember that] in the end unto Us you must return, whereupon We shall make you truly understand all that you were doing [in life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:42: The parable of the life of this world is but that of rain which We send down from the sky, and which is absorbed by the plants of the earth whereof men and animals draw nourishment, until – when the earth has assumed its artful adornment and has been embellished, and they who dwell on it believe that they have gained mastery over it – there comes down upon it Our judgment, by night or by day, and We cause it to become
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:43: a field mown down, as if there had been no yesterday.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:45: unto the abode of peace, and guides him that wills [to be guided] onto a straight way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:46: For those who persevere in doing good there is the ultimate good in store, and more [than that].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:47: But as for those who have done evil deeds – the recompense of an evil deed shall be the like thereof; and – since they will have none to defend them against God – ignominy will overshadow them as though their faces were veiled by the night’s own darkness: it is they who are destined for the fire, therein to abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:48: For one Day We shall gather them all together, and then We shall say unto those who [in their lifetime] ascribed divinity to aught but God, "Stand where you are, you and those [beings and powers] to whom you were wont to ascribe a share in God’s divinity!" – for by then We shall have
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:50: and none can bear witness between us and you as God does: we were, for certain, unaware of your worshipping .
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:51: There and then will every human being clearly apprehend what he has done in the past, and all will be brought back unto God, their true Lord Supreme, and all their false imagery will have forsaken them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:52: SAY: "Who is it that provides you with sustenance out of heaven and earth, or who is it that has full power over
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:53: hearing and sight? And who is it that brings forth the living out of that which is dead, and brings forth the dead out of that which is alive? And who is it that governs all that exists?" And they will
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:56: seeing that He is God, your Sustainer, the Ultimate Truth? For, after the truth [has been forsaken], what is there
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:57: but error? How, then, can you lose sight of the truth?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:58: Thus is thy Sustainer’s word proved true with regard to such as are bent on sinful doings: they will not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:59: Say: "Can any of those beings to whom you ascribe a share in God’s divinity create
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:60: in the first instance, and then bring it forth anew?" Say: "It is God
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:61: who creates [all life] in the first instance, and then brings it forth anew.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:62: Say: "Does any of those beings to whom you ascribe a share in God’s divinity guide unto the truth?" Say: "It is God
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:64: For most of them follow nothing but conjecture:
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:65: behold, conjecture can never be a substitute for truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:66: Now this Qur’ān could not possibly have been devised by anyone save God: nay indeed, it confirms the truth of whatever there still remains [of earlier revelations] and clearly spells out the revelation [which comes] – let there be no doubt about it – from the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:67: And yet, they [who are bent on denying the truth] assert, "
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:68: has invented it!" Say [unto them]: "Produce, then, a sūrah of similar merit; and [to this end] call to your aid whomever you can, other than God, if what you say is true!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:69: Nay, but they are bent on giving the lie to everything the wisdom whereof they do not comprehend, and ere its inner meaning has become clear to them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:70: And there are among them such as will in time come to believe in this [divine writ], just as there are among them such as will never believe in it; and thy Sustainer is fully aware as to who are the spreaders of corruption.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:71: And [so, O Prophet,] if they give thee the lie, say: "To me [shall be accounted] my doings, and to you, your doings: you are not accountable for what I am doing, and I am not accountable for whatever you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:72: And there are among them such as [pretend to] listen to thee: but canst thou cause the deaf to hearken even though they will not use their reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:73: And there are among them such as [pretend to] look towards thee: but canst thou show the right way to the blind even though they cannot see?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:74: Verily, God does not do the least wrong unto men, but it is men who wrong themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:75: And on the Day when He shall gather them [unto Himself, it will seem to them] as if they had not tarried [on earth] longer than an hour of a day, knowing one another;
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:76: lost indeed will be they who [in their lifetime] considered it a lie that they were destined to meet God and
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:77: failed to find the right way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:78: And whether We show thee [in this world] something of what We hold in store for those [deniers of the truth], or whether We cause thee to die [before that retribution takes place – know that, in the end], it is unto Us that they must return; and God is witness to all that they do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:79: NOW every community has had an apostle; and only after their apostle has appeared [and delivered his message] is judgment passed on them, in all equity; and never are they wronged.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:80: And yet, they [who deny the truth] are wont to ask, "When is that promise [of resurrection and judgment] to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:81: Say [O Prophet]: "It is not within my power to avert harm from, or bring benefit to, myself, except as God may please.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:82: Say: "Have you ever considered [how you would feel] if His chastisement were to befall you by night or by day? What could there be in that prospect that people lost in sin should wish to hasten?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:83: Will you, then, believe in it
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:84: after it has come to pass – [on the Day when you will be asked, ‘Do you believe in it] now, after having
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:86: whereupon those who [in their lifetime] were bent on evildoing will be told, ‘Taste suffering abiding! Is this requital anything but the just due for what you were wont to do?’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:87: And some people ask thee, "Is all this true?" Say: "Yea, by my Sustainer! It is most certainly true, and you cannot elude [the final reckoning]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:88: And all human beings that have been doing evil would surely, if they possessed all that is on earth, offer it as ransom [on Judgment Day]; and when they see the suffering [that awaits them], they will be unable to express their remorse.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:89: Oh, verily, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth! Oh, verily, God’s promise always comes true – but most of them know it not!
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:90: He alone grants life and deals death; and unto Him you all must return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:91: O MANKIND! There has now come unto you an admonition from your Sustainer, and a cure for all [the ill] that may be in men’s hearts, and guidance and grace unto all who believe [in Him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:93: bounty of God and in His grace – in this, then, let them rejoice: it is better than all [the worldly wealth] that they may amass!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:94: Say: "Have you ever considered all the means of sustenance which God has bestowed upon you from on high – and which you thereupon divide into ‘things forbidden’ and ‘things lawful’?" Say: "Has God given you leave [to do this] – or do you, perchance, attribute your own guesswork to God?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:95: But what do they think – they who attribute their own lying inventions to God – [what do they think will happen to them] on the Day of Resurrection? Behold, God is indeed limitless in His bounty unto men – but most of them are ungrateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:96: AND IN whatever condition thou mayest find thyself, [O Prophet,] and whatever discourse of this [divine writ] thou mayest be reciting, and whatever work you [all, O men,] may do – [remember that] We are your witness [from the moment] when you enter upon it: for not even an atom’s weight [of whatever there is] on earth or in heaven escapes thy Sustainer’s knowledge; and neither is there anything smaller than that, or larger, but is recorded in
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:98: Oh, verily, they who are close to God – no fear need they have, and neither shall they grieve:
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:99: they who have attained to faith and have always been conscious of Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:100: For them there is the glad tiding [of happiness] in the life of this world and in the life to come; [and since] nothing could ever alter [the outcome of] God’s promises, this, this is the triumph supreme!
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:101: And be not grieved by the sayings of those [who deny the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:102: OH, VERILY, unto God belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on earth: hence, what is it that they follow – those who invoke, beside God, beings to whom they ascribe a share in His divinity? They follow but the conjectures [of others], and themselves do nothing but guess
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:104: it is He who has made the night for you, so that you might have rest therein, and the day, to make
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:105: see: in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who [are willing to] listen.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:106: [And yet] they assert, "God has taken unto Himself a son!" Limitless is He in His glory! Self-sufficient is He: unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth! No evidence whatever have you for this !
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:107: Would you ascribe unto God something which you cannot know?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:108: Say: "Verily, they who attribute their own lying inventions to God will never attain to a happy state!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:109: [A brief] enjoyment in this world – and thereafter unto Us they must return: and then We shall let them taste suffering severe as an outcome of their persistent denial of the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:110: AND CONVEY unto them the story of Noah – when he said unto his people: "O my people! If my presence [among you] and my announcement of God’s messages are repugnant to you – well, in God have I placed my trust.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:111: But if you turn away [from the message which I bear, remember that] I have asked no reward whatever of you: my reward rests with none but God, for I have been bidden to be among those who have surrendered themselves unto Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:112: And yet they gave him the lie! And so We saved him and all who stood by him, in the ark, and made them inherit [the earth], the while We caused those who gave the lie to Our messages to drown: behold, then, what happened in the end to those people who had been warned [in vain]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:113: AND THEN, after him, We sent forth
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:114: apostles – each one unto his own people – and they brought them all evidence of the truth; but they would not believe in anything to which they had once given the lie: thus it is that We seal the hearts of such as [are wont to] transgress the bounds of what is right.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:115: And after those [earlier prophets] We sent Moses and Aaron with Our messages unto Pharaoh and his great ones: but they gloried in their arrogance, for they were people lost in sin.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:116: And so, when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Behold, this is clearly nothing but sorcery!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:117: Said Moses: "Do you speak thus of the truth after it has been brought to you? Can this be sorcery? But sorcerers can never come to a happy end!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:118: [The great ones] replied: "Hast thou come to turn us away from what we found our forefathers believing in and doing, so that the two of you might become supreme in this land? However, we do not believe in you two!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:119: And Pharaoh commanded: "Bring before me every sorcerer of great knowledge!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:120: And when the sorcerers came, Moses said unto them: "Throw whatever you may [wish to] throw!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:121: And when they threw down [their staffs and cast a spell upon the people’s eyes], Moses said unto them: "What you have contrived is
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:122: sorcery which, verily, God will bring to nought! Verily, God does not further the works of spreaders of corruption
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:123: whereas by His words God proves the truth to be true, however hateful this may be to those who are lost in sin!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:124: But none save a few of his people declared their faith in Moses, [while others held back] for fear of Pharaoh and their great ones, lest they persecute them: for, verily, Pharaoh was mighty on earth and was, verily, of those who are given to excesses.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:125: And Moses said: "O my people! If you believe in God, place your trust in Him – if you have
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:127: Whereupon they answered: "In God have we placed our trust! O our Sustainer, make us not a plaything for evildoing folk,
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:128: and save us, by Thy grace, from people who deny the truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:130: did We inspire Moses and his brother: "Set aside for your people some houses in the city, and [tell them], ‘Turn your houses into places of worship, and be constant in prayer!’ And give thou [O Moses] the glad tiding [of God’s succour] to all believers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:131: And Moses prayed: "O our Sustainer! Verily, splendour and riches hast Thou vouchsafed, in the life of this world, unto Pharaoh and his great ones – with the result, O our Sustainer, that they are leading
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:132: astray from Thy path! O our Sustainer! Wipe out their riches, and harden their hearts, so that they may not attain to faith ere they see the grievous suffering [that awaits them]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:134: answered: "Accepted is this your prayer! Continue, then, both of you, steadfastly on the right way, and follow not the path of those who have no knowledge [of right and wrong].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:135: And We brought the children of Israel across the sea; and thereupon Pharaoh and his hosts pursued them with vehement insolence and tyranny, until [they were overwhelmed by the waters of the sea.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:136: exclaimed: "I have come to believe that there is no deity save Him in whom the children of Israel believe, and I am of those who surrender themselves unto Him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:137: [But God said:] "Now? – when ever before this thou hast been rebelling [against Us], and hast been among those who spread corruption?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:139: but today We shall save only thy body, so that thou mayest be a
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:140: sign unto those who will come after thee: for, behold, a good many people are heedless of Our messages!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:142: indeed, We assigned unto the children of Israel a most goodly abode, and provided for them sustenance out of the good things of life.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:143: verily, thy Sustainer will judge between them on Resurrection Day regarding all on which they were wont to differ.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:144: AND SO, [O man,] if thou art in doubt about [the truth of] what We have
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:145: bestowed upon thee from on high, ask those who read the divine writ
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:146: before thy time: [and thou wilt find that,] surely, the truth has now come unto thee from thy Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:147: and neither be among those who are bent on giving the lie to God’s messages, lest thou find thyself among the lost.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:148: Verily, they against whom thy Sustainer’s word [of judgment] has come true will not attain to faith
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:149: even though every sign [of the truth] should come within their ken – until they behold the grievous suffering [that awaits them in the life to come].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:150: For, alas, there has never yet been any community that attained to faith [in its entirety,] and thereupon benefited by its faith, except the people of Jonah.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:151: And [thus it is:] had thy Sustainer so willed, all those who live on earth would surely have attained to faith, all of them: dost thou, then, think that thou couldst compel people to believe,
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:152: notwithstanding that no human being can ever attain to faith otherwise than by God’s leave, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:153: it is He who lays the loathsome evil [of disbelief] upon those who will not use their reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:154: Say: "Consider whatever there is in the heavens and on earth!" But of what avail could all the messages and all the warnings be to people who will not believe?
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:155: Can such, then, expect anything else [to befall them] but the like of the days of [calamity which befell] those [deniers of the truth] who passed away before them? Say: "Wait, then, [for what will happen:] verily, I shall wait with you!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:156: [For thus it always happens: We seal the doom of all who deny the truth and give the lie to Our messages;] and thereupon We save Our apostles and those who have attained to faith.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:157: SAY [O Prophet]: "O mankind! If you are in doubt as to what my faith is, then [know that] I do not worship those beings whom you worship beside God, but
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:158: I worship God alone, who shall cause you
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:159: to die: for I have been bidden to be among those who believe [in Him alone].
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:160: Hence, [O man,] set thy face steadfastly towards the
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:161: faith, turning away from all that is false, and be not among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside God.

Muhammad Asad.verse 10:163: And [know that] if God should touch thee with misfortune, there is none who could remove it save Him; and if He intends good for thee, there is none who could turn away His bounty: He causes it to alight upon whomsoever He wills of His servants.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:164: SAY [O Prophet]: "O mankind! The truth from your Sustainer has now come unto you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 10:165: And [as for thyself, O Muhammad,] follow but what is being revealed unto thee, and be patient in adversity, until God shall give His judgment: for He is the best of all judges.

Martin Lings.verse 10:3: Verily this lower life is but as water which we have sent down from the sky.
Martin Lings.verse 10:4: And Allah calls to the House of Peace, and guides whom He will towards the ascending Way.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:2: Is it surprising for the people that We have sent the divine revelation to a man from among them to direct him that he should warn the people (who are heedless), and give happy news to those who believe that they will have a truly excellent footing at a place near their Lord? The disbelievers said, “Surely, he is an open sorcerer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:3: Surely, your Lord is Allah, the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and then He positioned Himself on the Throne.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:4: Towards Him all of you have to return, this being a true promise from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:5: He is the One who has made the sun a glow, and the moon a light, and determined for it stages, so that you may learn the number of the years, and the calculation (of time).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:6: Surely, in the alternation of night and day and in what Allah has created in the heavens and the earth, there are signs for a people who are God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:7: As for those who do not believe in meeting Us and are quite happy with the life of this world and are content with it, and those who are heedless to Our signs,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:8: they are the ones whose abode is the Fire, because of what they used to earn for themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:9: As for those who believe and do good deeds, their Lord will guide them by virtue of their belief; rivers will be flowing beneath them in the Gardens of Bliss.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:10: Their call therein will be, “Pure are You, O Allah” and their greeting therein will be Salām .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:11: And if Allah were to hasten in sending evil to the people, as they hasten in seeking good, their time would have been all over.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:12: When man is afflicted by a hardship, he prays to Us (at all times), when reclining or sitting or standing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:13: Indeed We have destroyed generations before you when they transgressed, and their Messengers had come to them with clear signs, but they were not the ones who would believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:14: Then We made you (their) successors in the land, so that We see how you would act.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:15: When Our verses are recited to them in all their clarity, say those who do not believe in meeting Us, “Bring a Qur’ān other than this, or make changes in it (to suit our fancies)”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:16: Say, “Had Allah so willed, I would have not recited it to you, nor would He have let you know it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:17: So, who is more unjust than the one who forges a lie against Allah or gives the lie to His signs? Indeed (such) guilty people shall not achieve success.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:18: Beside Allah, they worship those who can neither harm nor benefit them, and they say, “These are our intercessors with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:19: All the people were no more than a single community; later, they differed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:20: And they say, “Why is it that no sign has been sent down to him from his Lord?” Say, “The Unseen is only for Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:21: Once We cause people to taste a blessing after a hardship having afflicted them, they at once start devising plans against Our verses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:22: He is the One who enables you to travel on land and at sea, until when you are aboard the boats, and they sail with those on board, under a favorable wind, and they are pleased with it, there comes upon them a violent wind, and the wave comes upon them from every direction, and they think that they are surrounded from all sides, they pray to Allah, having faith in Him alone, (and say,) “If You deliver us from this, we shall be grateful indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:23: But when He delivers them, they at once start rebelling on the earth wrongfully.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:24: The example of worldly life is just like the water We sent down from the sky, then the vegetation of the earth grew with it, which is (meant to be) eaten by men and cattle, until when the earth took on its ornament and was fully adorned, and its people thought that they had control over it, Our command came to it at night or by day, and We turned it into a stubble, as if it had not been there a day earlier.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:25: Allah invites (people) to the Abode of Peace and brings whom He wills to a straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:26: For those who do good there is the best, and something more.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:27: As for those who commit evils, the recompense of each evil shall be similar to that evil, and disgrace shall cover them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:28: And (be mindful of) the Day when We shall gather them together, then We shall say to those who associated partners with Allah, “Wait in your place, you and your associate-gods.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:29: So, Allah is enough as witness between us and between you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:30: Thereupon, everyone shall assess what one had sent ahead, and they will be sent back to Allah, their true Lord, and whatever they used to fabricate will vanish from them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:31: Say, “Who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth? Or, who controls the (powers of) hearing and seeing? And who brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living? And who manages everything?” They will say, “Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:32: So, that is Allah, your Lord in truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:33: This is how the Word of your Lord has come true about the sinners that they will not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:34: Say, “Is there any one from your ‘associate-gods’ who originates the creation, then brings it again? To where then, are you being turned away (by your desires)?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:35: Say, “Is there any one from your associate-gods who guides to the truth?” Say, “Allah guides to the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:36: Most of them follow nothing but conjectures.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:37: And this Qur’ān is not such as could have been made up by someone without (having been revealed by) Allah, but it is a confirmation of that (discourse) which had been (revealed) before it, and an elaboration of what is prescribed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:38: Or, do they say that he has made it up? Say, “Then, bring a Sūrah like this, and call whomsoever you can beside Allah, if you are true.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:39: But they have rejected a thing they could not comprehend with knowledge, while its ultimate end has not appeared to them as yet.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:40: And among them there are those who believe in it, and among them there are others who do not believe in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:41: And if they give the lie to you, say, “For me, my deed, and for you, your deed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:42: And among them there are those who listen to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:43: And among them there are those who look at you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:44: Surely, Allah does not wrong people at all, but the people do wrong their own selves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:45: The Day when He will gather them (in the next life,) they will feel as if they had not stayed (in the world) any longer than a fraction of a day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:46: No matter whether We show you (during your life) some of what We warn them of, or We take you back to Us (before it), in any case, they have to return to Us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:47: For every people there is a messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:48: They say, “When will this promise (of punishment to the disbelievers) be fulfilled if you are true?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:49: Say, “I have no power to bring a harm or a benefit to myself, except what Allah wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:50: Say, “Just tell me, if His punishment befalls you at night or by day, what (desirable thing) will it have that the sinners are asking it so hurriedly?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:51: Is it only when it befalls you that you will believe in it? (It will be said to you at that time, “Have you believed) now, while you used to demand (in mockery) that it should come sooner?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:52: Then it will be said to the unjust, “Taste the punishment lasting for ever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:53: They ask you to tell them whether it is true.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:54: If anyone who did wrong possesses all that is on the earth, he would (agree to) ransom himself with it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:55: Look! To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:56: He gives life and brings death, and to Him you shall be returned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:57: O men, there has come to you an advice from your Lord, and a cure for the ailments of your hearts, and guidance and mercy for the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:58: Say, “With the grace of Allah and with His mercy (this book has been revealed).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:59: Say, “Have you ever considered, whatever provision Allah has sent down for your benefit, you have made up lawful and unlawful from it?” Say, “Has Allah permitted you or are you fabricating a lie against Allah?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:60: What is the assumption of those who fabricate a lie against Allah (about) the Day of Judgment? Indeed Allah is gracious to people, but most of them are not grateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:61: In whatever condition you are, and whatever portion of the Qur’ān you recite therein, and whatever work you all do, We are present before you when you are engaged in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:62: Listen, the friends of Allah shall have no fear, nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:63: -those who have believed and have been fearful of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:64: For them there is the good news in the worldly life and in the Hereafter: there is no change in the words of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:65: (O Prophet,) what they say should not make you grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:66: Listen, to Allah belong all those in the heavens and all those on the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:67: He is the One who made for you the night, so that you may have rest in it, and (made) the day to see.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:68: They say, “Allah has got a son.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:69: Say: Those who fabricate lies against Allah shall not prosper.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:70: It will be a little enjoyment in this world; thereafter to Us they are bound to return; then We shall make them taste the severe punishment, because they used to disbelieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:71: Recite to them the story of (the Prophet) NūH (Noah), when he said to his people, “O my people, if it is hard on you that I stay (with you) and give (you) advice through the signs of Allah, then, in Allah I place my trust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:72: Still, if you turn away, then, I did not demand any reward from you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:73: Then they rejected him, and We saved him and those with him in the Ark and made them the successors, and drowned those who gave the lie to Our signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:74: Then, after him, We sent messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear signs, but they were not to believe in what they had rejected earlier.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:75: Then, after them, We sent Mūsā and Hārūn with Our signs to Pharaoh and his group, but they showed arrogance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:76: So, when Truth came to them from Us, they said, “It is certainly a clear magic.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:77: Mūsā said, “Do you say (this) about the Truth when it came to you? Is this magic, while the magicians do not achieve success?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:78: They said, “Have you come to us to turn us away from the way on which we have found our fathers, and so that you both have supremacy on earth? We are not going to believe in you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:79: And Pharaoh said, “Bring to me every knowledgeable magician.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:80: So, when the magicians came, Mūsā said to them, “Cast what you have to cast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:81: So, when they had cast, Mūsā said, “All that you have brought is magic.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:82: And Allah establishes the truth through His words, even though the guilty ones may dislike it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:83: Then, except some youths of his people, no one believed in Mūsā for the fear of Pharaoh and his group, lest he should persecute them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:84: And Mūsā said, “My people, if you have believed in Allah, then, in Him place your trust if you are obedient.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:85: So, they said, “In Allah we have placed our trust: Our Lord, do not make us a victim of the unjust people,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:86: and save us, through Your mercy, from the disbelieving people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:87: And We revealed to Mūsā and his brother: “Have houses for your people in Egypt, and make your houses worship oriented, and establish Salāh, and give good tidings to the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:88: Mūsā said, “Our Lord, You have given Pharaoh and his group glamour and riches in the worldly life, so that, our Lord, they mislead (people) from Your path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:89: Allah said, “The prayer of the two of you has been granted; so stand firm, and never follow the way of the ignorant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:90: And We let the children of Isrā’īl cross the sea.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:91: (Allah said,) “Is it now (that you have come to believe) while you were rebellious all along, and you were among the mischief-makers?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:92: So, today, We shall save your body, so that you may become a sign for those after you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:93: And surely We gave the children of Isrā’īl a proper place to live, and provided them with good things.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:94: So, (O prophet,) even if you are in doubt about what We have sent down to you, ask those who read the Book (revealed) before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:95: And never be among those who have rejected Our signs, lest you should be among the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:96: Surely, those against whom the Word of your Lord stands settled will not believe,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:97: even though every sign comes to them, unless they witness the painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:98: So, how is it that there never was a town, which could have believed and its belief would have been of benefit to it, except the people of Yūnus? When they came to believe, We removed from them the punishment of humiliation in the worldly life and let them enjoy themselves for some time.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:99: Had your Lord willed, all those on earth would have believed altogether.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:100: It is not (possible) for any one that he believes except with the will of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:101: Say, “Look at what is there in the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:102: So, are they waiting for nothing short of something like the days of those who have passed before them? Say, “So wait.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:103: Then We (used to) save Our messengers and those who believed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:104: Say, “O people, if you are in doubt about my Faith, then, I do not worship those whom you worship beside Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:105: and that I should make myself firm on Faith, being upright, and never should be among the Mushriks (who ascribe partners to Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:106: And do not invoke, other than Allah, what neither benefits you nor harms you, for, if you do so, then you will surely be one of the unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:107: If Allah brings some harm to you, there is none to remove it except He.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:108: Say, “O people, the truth has come to you from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 10:109: Follow what is being revealed to you, and be patient until Allah gives His judgment, and He is the best of all judges.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:2: Is it for the people a wonder that We have inspired a man from among them :
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:3: 'Warn the people and give good tidings to those who believe that they have a prior [promise of] truth with their Lord'? The disbelievers say, 'Truly this is manifest sorcery'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:4: Truly your Lord is God Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then He presided upon the Throne, directing affairs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:5: To Him is the return of all of you: God's promise, in truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:6: He it is Who made the sun a radiance, and the moon a light, and determined it in stations so that you might know the number of the years and the reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:7: Truly in the alternation of night and day, and
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:8: what God has created in the heavens and the earth there are signs for a people who fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:9: Truly those who do not expect to encounter Us, and are content with the life of this world, and feel reassured in it, and those who are heedless of Our signs,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:10: those, their abode will be the Fire because of what they used to earn.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:11: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds, their Lord will guide them through their faith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:12: their prayer therein: 'Glory be to You, O God!', and their greeting therein will be: 'Peace'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:13: And if God should hasten for mankind evil as they would hasten good, their term [of life] would already have been concluded for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:14: If misfortune should befall a man, he calls upon Us on his side, or sitting or standing; but when We have relieved him of his misfortune, he passes on, as if he had never called upon Us because of a misfortune that befell him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:15: And indeed We have destroyed generations before you, when they did evil, and their messengers brought them clear proofs; but they would not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:16: Then We made you successors in the earth after them, that We might behold how you would behave.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:17: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, those who do not expect to encounter Us, say, ‘Bring a Qur’ān other than this, or change it’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:18: Say: ‘If God had willed I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:21: And who does greater evil than he who invents a lie against God or denies His signs? Surely, the sinners shall not prosper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:22: And they worship, besides God that which can neither hurt them, nor profit them; and they say, 'These are our intercessors with God'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:23: Mankind was but one community; then they differed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:24: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down on him from his Lord?' Then say, 'The Unseen belongs only to God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:25: And when We made people taste of mercy after adversity that had afflicted them, behold! they have some plot concerning Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:26: He it is Who conveys you across the land and the sea, until when you are in ships and they sail with them with a fair breeze and they rejoice therein, there comes upon them a stormy wind, , and waves come on them from every side, and they think that they are overwhelmed, they call upon God, secure in their faith only to Him: ‘If You deliver us from these, we shall verily be of the thankful’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:27: Yet when He has delivered them, behold! they are insolent in the earth wrongfully.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:28: The likeness of the life of this world is only as water, which We send down from the heaven, then the plants of the earth mingle with it, whereof mankind eat, and cattle
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:29: until, when the earth has taken on its ornaments, and has adorned itself, and its inhabitants think that they are masters of it, Our command comes upon it by night or day, and We make it as reaped corn, as though the previous day it had not flourished.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:30: And God summons to the Abode of Peace, and He guides whomever He wills to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:31: For those who do good is the fairest reward and more; neither dust, nor ignominy shall overcome their faces.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:32: And for those who earn evil deeds, [there shall be] the requital of an evil deed by the like thereof; ignominy shall overcome them - they have no protector against God - as if their faces had been covered with strips of darkest night.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:33: And the day on which We shall gather them all together, then We shall say to those who associated others [with God]: 'In your place! You and your associates!' Then We shall make a separation between them; and their associates will say: 'It was not us that you were worshipping;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:34: God suffices as a witness between us and you, that indeed we were unaware of your worship'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:35: There every soul shall experience what it did before, and they shall be returned to God, their rightful Lord, and that which they were inventing shall fail them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:36: Say: 'Who provides for you out of the heaven, and the earth, or Who owns hearing and sight, and Who brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and Who directs affairs?' They will surely say: 'God'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:37: That then is God, your true Lord: so what is there, after truth, except error? How then are you turned away?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:38: Thus, the Word of your Lord is justified concerning those who are wicked that they do not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:39: Say: 'Is there of those whom you associate [with God] one that originates creation, then recreated it?' Say: 'God originates creation, then recreates it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:40: Say: 'Is there of those whom you associate [with God] one that guides to the truth?' Say: 'God guides to the truth; is One Who guides to the truth more deserving of being followed, or one who does not guide, unless he is guided? So what is wrong with you, how do you judge?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:41: And most of them follow nothing but conjecture; truly conjecture avails nothing against truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:42: And this Qur’ān is not such as could ever be produced [by anyone] besides God; but it is a confirmation of what is before it, and a detailing of the Book, wherein is no doubt from the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:43: Or do they say, ‘He has invented it?’ Say: ‘Then bring a sūra like it; and call upon whom you can besides God if you are truthful’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:44: Nay, but they denied that, the knowledge whereof they did not comprehend; and whereof the interpretation has not yet come to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:45: And of them are some who believe in it and some who would never believe therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:46: If they deny you, then say, 'Unto me is my work, and to you your work; you are innocent of what I do, and I am innocent of what you do'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:47: And of them are some who listen to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:48: And of them are some who look toward you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:49: Verily God does not wrong mankind in any way, but mankind wrong themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:50: And on the day when He shall gather them as if they had not tarrie, but an hour of the day, recognising one another; those will verily have lost who denied the encounter with God, for they were not guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:51: And whether We show you something of that which We promise them, or We take you [to Us], to Us they shall return, and God, moreover, is Witness of what they do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:52: And for every community there is a messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:53: And they say: 'When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:54: Say: 'I have no power to hurt myself, or to benefit, except as God might will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:55: Say: 'Have you considered if His chastisement comes upon you by night or day, what is there of it that the sinners seek to hasten?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:57: then, when it has come to pass, that you will believe therein? Now, when [until now] you have been hastening it on?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:58: Then will it be said to those who were evildoers: 'Taste the everlasting chastisement! Are you requited for anything but what you used to earn?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:59: And they ask you to tell them, 'Is it true?' Say: 'Aye, by my Lord! Verily it is true and you cannot escape'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:60: And if each soul that has done wrong had all that is in the earth, it would offer it as ransom; and they will feel remorse within them when they see the chastisement; but it has been decided justly between them, and they are not wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:61: Why, surely to God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:62: He gives life and makes to die, and to Him you shall be returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:63: O people! There has come to you an admonition from your Lord, and a healing for what is in the breasts, and a guidance, and a mercy for those who believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:64: Say: 'In the bounty of God, and in His mercy in that let them rejoice: it is better than what they hoard'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:65: Say: 'Have you considered what provision God has revealed for you, how you have made some of it unlawful and some lawful?' Say: 'Has God given you permission, or do you invent lies concerning God?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:66: And what do they suppose, those who invent lies concerning God, [will happen to them] on the Day of Resurrection? Truly God is Bountiful to mankind, but most of them do not give thanks.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:67: And you are not occupied with any business, nor do you recite anything regarding it by way of the Qur’ān, nor do you perform any action — but We are witnesses over you when you are engaged therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:68: Assuredly God's friends, no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:70: Theirs are good tidings in the life of this world and in the Hereafter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:71: And let not what they say grieve you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:72: Why, surely to God belongs all who are in the heavens and all who are in the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:73: He it is Who made for you the night that you should rest therein, and the day to see.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:74: They say, 'God has taken [to Him] a son'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:75: Say: 'Truly those who invent lies concerning God shall not prosper'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:76: Enjoyment in this world, then to Us is their return, then We shall make them taste terrible chastisement because they used to disbelieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:77: And recite to them the story of Noah when he said to his people, 'O my people, if my sojourn is too great [to bear] for you, as is my reminding you by the signs of God, in God have I put my trust; so decide upon your course of action together with your associates, then let not your decision be a secret between you; then implement it against me, and do not put it off.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:78: But if you turn away, I have not asked you for any wage: my wage falls only on God, and I have been commanded to be of those who submit [to God]'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:79: But they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:80: Then, after him We sent messengers to their people, and they brought them clear proofs, but it was not for them to believe in that which they had denied before.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:81: Then, after them, We sent Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his council with Our signs, but they were disdainful and were a sinful folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:82: So, when the Truth came to them from Us, they said, 'Surely this is manifest sorcery'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:84: of the Truth when it has come to you? Is this sorcery? Now sorcerers do not prosper'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:85: They said, ‘Have you come to us to divert us from what we found our fathers following, and that yours both might be the greatness in the land? We will not believe you two’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:86: And Pharaoh said, 'Bring me every cunning sorcerer'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:87: And when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, 'Cast your cast!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:88: Then, when they had cast, Moses said, 'What have you brought? Sorcery? Verily God will bring it to nothing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 10:89: And God will vindicate the Truth by His words, however much the sinners be averse'.
